wow, terrible movie - seems like the writers and artists didn't play any of the games - style and tone is way off - stross is completely unrecognizable in this compared to DS2 - no real links, and totally irrational/illogical characters - totally infuriating - i thought these spacemen were professionals like doctors and engineers and soldiers - their combined IQ is somewhere around a small bag of cheetos - the kind that are given out during halloween - also, at some point they just throw progression out the window and instantly the ship is completely swarming with all types of monsters - can you say "cashgrab"? 

the cg looks like early ps2 cutscenes or something. 

thanks for the up, though - quality is high

@Shadow_Dreamer: you are right. Mi LG LE5500 TV can play this kind of files directly from the USB. It supports H264 (x264), DivX, XVid...inside AVI, MKV, etc. Up to 1080p. It doesn't supports DTS audio but you can reencodeit to AAC with Avidemux.

Whoever finds this torrent is probably too intent on watching to listen to those adivising against the waste of time, seeing as the downloading is fast for most, too.

Well, I'll pitch in as well, nonetheless.
If you must watch to sate your curiosity, go ahead, it's not that much of a waste of time.
But you will be disappointed. The CG segments really are mediocre. The drawn segments differ, they are not all done in the same style and at least one of them is awfully bad.
And then we come to the script - this is absolutely the worst detail. Whoever produced this is below average and has weak creativity and imagination. And whoever directed is about as bad. The movie is meant to give the scares, but it will mostly just frustrate you with its stupidity. Just about every plot development is forced and doesn't come about realistically.

Ah hell... I, for one, liked the game very much and was longing to watch something Dead Space where there's actually more than just the hero and swarm of necromorphs with occasional NPC interactions, but turns out this movie is manages to fall short of the first one.

Sorry to burst your bubble, but if I convince you of the disappointment now, I'm also saving you some time.
Hell, at least we're not paying for it, blessed be the PB. This is the kind of thing you'd feel is really stupid to receive as a gift, utter waste of money.

Now, onto actually good entertainment: Dead Space 2 for the PC.
By the way, Christopher Judge (Teal'c) voices the black guy here. What a waste of talent!
this movie sucks so hard. huge letdown, because the first anime was pretty solid. the games are very good too, but this shit... oh man...
